@gunan well, there is already a CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH line here, simply removing it also work.
Ideally, the Dockerfile should not have to specify CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH, CUDA_PATH or CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH, if the configure step use sensible default values when looking for CUDA/cuDNN. Those variables should only be needed when you have a truly unusual CUDA install path like /home/felix/cuda.

Also, the LD_LIBRARY_PATH line you mentioned is bogus, see #4363
